intro: Hieracium stenolonchum, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. It has a basal rosette of leaves that are generally lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs in summer, producing yellow flowers that attract various pollinators.
